016package edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.controller;
017
018import android.annotation.SuppressLint;
019import android.app.Activity;
020import android.app.Dialog;
021import android.content.Context;
022import android.content.res.Resources;
023import android.os.Bundle;
024import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
025import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
026import androidx.appcompat.app.AlertDialog;
027import androidx.fragment.app.DialogFragment;
028import dagger.hilt.android.AndroidEntryPoint;
029import edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.R;
030import java.util.Arrays;
031import java.util.Objects;
032import java.util.stream.Collectors;
033
034/**
035 * Presents a modal dialog of rationales for permissions requested by this app. No permissions are
036 * actually requested in this fragment; instead, rationales for previously declined permissions are
037 * read from string resources and displayed to the user. On user acknowledgement, control is passed
038 * back to the host activity, which <strong>must</strong> implement the
039 * {@link OnAcknowledgeListener} interface nested in this class.
040 * <p>This fragment is intended to be instantiated and displayed via the Navigation framework, with
041 * two {@link String String[]} arguments provided&mdash;one containing permissions to explain, and
042 * the other containing permissions to request. (The latter are simply passed back to the host
043 * activity, for subsequent invocation of
044 * {@link androidx.core.app.ActivityCompat#requestPermissions(Activity, String[], int)}.)</p>
045 * <p>Rationales for permissions being explained are read from string resources, identified by
046 * taking the last component of the permission name, converting it to lower case, appending
047 * "_explanation", and using the result as the name of a string resource. If no such resource
048 * corresponding to a given permission exists, no rationale for that permission will be
049 * displayed.</p>
050 */
051@AndroidEntryPoint
052public class PermissionsExplanationFragment extends DialogFragment {
053
054  private static final String EXPLANATION_RESOURCE_SUFFIX = "_explanation";
055
056  private Context context;
057  private String[] permissionsToExplain;
058  private String[] permissionsToRequest;
059
060  @Override
061  public void onCreate(@Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {
062    super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
063    context = getContext();
064    PermissionsExplanationFragmentArgs args =
065        PermissionsExplanationFragmentArgs.fromBundle(getArguments());
066    permissionsToExplain = args.getPermissionsToExplain();
067    permissionsToRequest = args.getPermissionsToRequest();
068  }
069
070  @NonNull
071  @Override
072  public Dialog onCreateDialog(@Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {
073    String message = buildMessage();
074    OnAcknowledgeListener listener = Objects.requireNonNull((OnAcknowledgeListener) getActivity());
075    return new AlertDialog.Builder(context)
076        .setIcon(android.R.drawable.ic_dialog_alert)
077        .setTitle(R.string.permissions_dialog_title)
078        .setMessage(message)
079        .setNeutralButton(android.R.string.ok,
080            (d, w) -> listener.onAcknowledge(permissionsToRequest))
081        .create();
082  }
083
084  @Nullable
085  private String buildMessage() {
086    String packageName = context.getPackageName();
087    Resources res = getResources();
088    return Arrays
089        .stream(permissionsToExplain)
090        .map((permission) -> {
091          String[] parts = permission.split("\\.");
092          String permissionKey =
093              parts[parts.length - 1].toLowerCase() + EXPLANATION_RESOURCE_SUFFIX;
094          @SuppressLint("DiscouragedApi")
095          int id = res.getIdentifier(permissionKey, "string", packageName);
096          return (id != 0) ? getString(id) : null;
097        })
098        .filter(Objects::nonNull)
099        .distinct()
100        .collect(Collectors.joining("\n"));
101  }
102
103  /**
104   * Declares the {@link #onAcknowledge(String[])} method to be implemented by the host activity
105   * (typically using a lambda), to resume the permissions flow after display of the permission
106   * rationales/explanations.
107   */
108  public interface OnAcknowledgeListener {
109
110    /**
111     * Invoked after user acknowledgement of permission rationales, to resume permissions flow.
112     *
113     * @param permissions Permissions to be requested of the user.
114     */
115    void onAcknowledge(String[] permissions);
116
117  }
118
119}
